addProtocolRiskPool(address,(uint128,uin.details: Can only be called by the owner (DAO/multisig).

params.claimFeeBps: The fee taken on claims, in basis points.
params.protocolTokenToCover: The address of the token being insured.
params.rateModel: The rate model parameters for calculating premiums.

returns._0: poolId The ID of the newly created pool.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

reportIncident(uint256,bool).details: This is a critical safety function to be used during incidents.

params.pauseState: The new pause state (true = paused, false = unpaused).
params.poolId: The ID of the pool to update.

setAddresses(address).details: Can only be called by the owner.

setCommittee(address).details: The committee has special privileges, such as pausing pools.

setPoolFeeRecipient(uint256,address).details: Typically used to redirect fees during an incident.

params.poolId: The ID of the pool to update.
params.recipient: The address of the new fee recipient.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addProtocolRiskPool(address,(uint128,uin.notice: Adds a new risk pool to the protocol.

reportIncident(uint256,bool).notice: Called by the Committee to pause or unpause a pool.

setAddresses(address).notice: Sets the address of the PoolRegistry contract.

setCommittee(address).notice: Sets the address of the governance committee.

setPoolFeeRecipient(uint256,address).notice: Called by the Committee to set the fee recipient for a pool.
